Description: Bronze finger-ring; Stirrup-shaped of Egyptian type; rectangular bezel engraved with a figure of Bes to front with hands on knees and wearing a crown of feathers; on either side is a uraeus; one shoulder is broken away from the hoop.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (1217)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 312)
Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (No. 35)
Catling 1964 / Cypriot Bronzework in the Mycenaean World (234-5, No. 2)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P46, Pl XII)
